title: NIO Inc. Weekly News Summary
body:
**Financial Performance:**

NIO Inc. reported its third-quarter 2025 financial results, revealing a mixed performance. The company posted a non-GAAP loss per share of RMB 1.49, which was narrower than the anticipated loss of RMB 1.67. However, revenue fell short of expectations, coming in at RMB 21.79 billion (approximately USD 3.06 billion) against the projected RMB 22.35 billion. Despite the revenue miss, NIO's stock experienced a pre-market increase of about 2.6%, indicating investor optimism regarding the company's cost management efforts. ([chartmill.com](https://www.chartmill.com/news/NIO/Chartmill-38256-NIO-INC---ADR-NYSENIO-Q3-2025-Earnings-EPS-Beat-Offsets-Revenue-Miss-Stock-Rises?utm_source=openai))

**Legal Challenges:**

Singapore's sovereign wealth fund, GIC, has filed a lawsuit against NIO, alleging that the company improperly recognized revenue from battery sales to its affiliate, Weineng. The suit claims that NIO's accounting practices led to inflated earnings reports, potentially misleading investors. This legal action has added to the scrutiny surrounding NIO's financial disclosures. ([nasdaq.com](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/investment-case-nio-stock-it-faces-gic-lawsuit?utm_source=openai))

**Market Reaction:**

Following the earnings announcement and the news of the lawsuit, NIO's stock experienced volatility. On October 14, 2025, the stock declined by 5.29%, influenced by the earnings miss and production delays. Subsequently, on December 3, 2025, the stock plummeted by 5.63%, marking its worst single-day drop since late 2024. These fluctuations reflect investor concerns over the company's financial health and strategic direction. ([ainvest.com](https://www.ainvest.com/news/nio-5-29-plunge-sends-0-39-billion-volume-292nd-rank-earnings-production-delays-collide-2510/?utm_source=openai))
